title: I'm Probably Going to Get Downvoted For This
body:
As a Talon main, I can almost see what's going to happen to him. You're going to change him into some crazy mobile champion that EVERYONE is going to play/complain about, and he's going to be played in the LCS, and everyone will call him broken/easy/etc. Then you'll nerf him patch after patch because he is too strong, and then he'll be useless. 

Well I'm begging you on behalf of myself and fellow Talon mains, don't. Please, for the love of god and all things holy please, please, PLEASE don't. I want to be able to play Talon after the rework without being called a meta slave, or people saying the only reason I did well is because Talon is broken. I want to actually make it through a champion select without him being banned or taken. 

Please just remember the people who played the champion PRE rework when you rework the champ; keep them in mind because we all play our mains for a reason, and it would suck if that was taken away. 


Thanks.

Now it didnt get a ton of up votes but it was positive......nowhere near the previous version which was like -30

Try it.....next time you make a post that gets a lot of down votes.....wait a week and make the same post and just change your wording so you dont sound negative and put that you will get down voted. Your message will remain the same but u will get a different reaction.

I think it would be cool if they gave Talon, or anyone being reworked, more "assassin-like" elements other than mobility and burst. For example, what if Talon's passive became a bleed, and like Darius', it would stack upon AA's and abilities, though instead of doing more damage, it would refresh the effect and increase the max duration of the effect. The catch would be that the bleed would leave a visual effect on the ground that _would not_ become invisible upon losing vision of the enemy. Doesn't necessarily have to be Talon, just thought it would be a cool thing that felt like it belonged to an assassin, that wasn't burst or mobililty.
But the point of an assassin is to quickly kill a victim without leaving a trace. A bleed effect would be more of a fighter or hunter themed thing.
